Action against Transfer of U.S. Military Base Starts in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- The members of the Phaengsong-up measure committee against the expansion of the U.S. military base started on Jan. 3 a tour of all parts of south Korea by tractors in protest against the transfer of the U.S. military base in Ryongsan to Phyongthaek, according to the south Korean MBC.
 They held a ceremony of starting the tour near the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek that morning. Speakers there declared their action was to pool the will of the people opposed to the transfer of the U.S. military base.    
 At the end of the ceremony, they left Phyongthaek, Kyonggi Province, aboard tractors.

articles.title: Anti-Imperialist Independence Called for
Removal of Concrete Wall Demanded
Intensified Movement for Korea's Reunification Called for
articles.content:
Removal of Concrete Wall Demanded 
    Pyongyang, January 6 (KCNA) -- The concrete wall built in the area south of the Military Demarcation Line dividing the Korean Peninsula should be pulled down without delay.
 The World Federation of Trade Unions (WFTU) said this in a statement on Dec. 28 last year. The wall is a shameful leftover contrary to the desire of all the Korean people for the reunification of their country, it noted, and continued:    
 The WFTU will always stand by the Korean people in their struggle to achieve the reunification of the country free from any form of imperialist interference.
